===2010s===
===2010s===
â
[[File:horizon brand new.jpg|thumb|left|An [[Alaska Airlines]] livery Horizon Air [[Bombardier Dash 8|Bombardier Q400]] Concept paint job.]]
  â  
On August 23, 2010, it was announced that Horizon's business model was to change to having all decisions about route choices and marketing services being made by Alaska Airlines by the beginning of 2011. The business model Alaska Air Group Inc. is adapting is called the "Capacity Purchase Agreement." The change would mean that all ticket revenue would go to Alaska Airlines, and Horizon's operating costs would be covered by Alaska Airlines. Before the change, limited amounts of Horizon routes had been operated as such, but more had been run entirely by Horizon.<ref>{{cite web|title=Horizon Air Changes Business Model|url=http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/generic/story_generic.jsp?channel=aviationdaily&id=news/avd/2010/08/23/08.xml&headline=Horizon%20Air%20Changes%20Business%20Model|publisher=Aviation Week|accessdate=26 August 2010|date=23 August 2010}}</ref>
On August 23, 2010, it was announced that Horizon's business model was to change to having all decisions about route choices and marketing services being made by Alaska Airlines by the beginning of 2011. The business model Alaska Air Group Inc. is adapting is called the "Capacity Purchase Agreement." The change would mean that all ticket revenue would go to Alaska Airlines, and Horizon's operating costs would be covered by Alaska Airlines. Before the change, limited amounts of Horizon routes had been operated as such, but more had been run entirely by Horizon.<ref>{{cite web|title=Horizon Air Changes Business Model|url=http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/generic/story_generic.jsp?channel=aviationdaily&id=news/avd/2010/08/23/08.xml&headline=Horizon%20Air%20Changes%20Business%20Model|publisher=Aviation Week|accessdate=26 August 2010|date=23 August 2010}}</ref>
